_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: All Other Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing
Pesticide and Other Agricultural Chemical Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary - Kemira Chemicals Inc.
Plant: Washougal, WA


Facility Description and Regulated Substances Handled:

Kemira is a chemical manufacturing company, headquartered in Finland with North American operations based in Kennesaw, GA.  We produce products for several diverse industries including paper manufacturing, pigment mining, textile sizing, paint manufacturing, water treatment and agricultural pest control. 

The Washougal, Washington facility manufactures products for paper, water treatment and agricultural markets. The portion of the plant covered by Risk Management, makes two dithiocarbamate products that are sold to other chemical companies for use in agricultural pest control and for use in wastewater treatment.  The Washougal facility is 15 years old, and  the Organics Unit producing these dithiocarbamates is about 8 years old. 

The Organics Unit uses three raw materials that are covered under Risk Management:  carbon disulfide, methylamine and dimethylamine. EPA lists carbon disulfide as a Toxic; the two anhydrous amines are listed as flammables. 

Carbon disulfide:
    Clear, colorless liquid with a garlic-like odor
    Flammable in liquid and vapor form
    Direct contact to skin and eyes will cause irritation. 
    Liquid contact to eyes can result in severe pain. 
    Inhalation of fumes can cause nausea, vomiting and headaches.
    Prolonged exposure to high concentrations may be fatal

Methylamine
    Clear, colorless, flammable gas with a fishy odor. 
    Slightly heavier than air
    Contact with the eyes can result in severe pain and irritation. 
    Contact with the skin can cause burns or blistering.
    Inhalation of fumes can cause nausea, vomiting and headaches.
    Prolonged exposure to high concentrations may be fatal

Dimethylamine
    Clear, colorless, flammable gas with a fishy or ammonia odor
    Slightly heavier than air
    Exposure can be irritating to the eyes and throat
    Liquid contact with the eyes can result in severe pain and corneal injury. 
    Contact with th

e skin can cause dermatitis or blistering.
    Inhalation of fumes can cause nausea, vomiting and headaches.
    Prolonged exposure to high concentrations may be fatal


Facility Safety Policies and Practices:

The Kemira, Washougal Plant is committed to the safety and protection of the environment.    At the Washougal plant, safety is each employees responsibility.  Safety is stressed ahead of production and employees are encouraged to take the extra steps and time necessary to ensure safe production and maintenance activities.  The main thrust of the safety program at washougal is the accident prevention program.  The accident prevention program addresses issues such as employee training, personnel protective equipment, plant safety audits, and life-critical procedures.  The plant has a safety committee made up of a cross-section of employees.  The safety committee meets monthly to address immediate safety concerns as well as to assess the overall safety program.  Each employee work crew conducts a weekly safety meeting.  Each employee participates in Behaviorial Based Safety, which is stressed throughout the company as well as Washougal.  

The Washougal plant works closely with South West Clean Air Agency (SWCAA) to minimize emmissions and ensure protection of the environment.  The Organics plant is a closed system.  All process vents are scrubbed at over 99% efficiency with recovered chemicals reused in the process.  The process is leak-checked quarterly.  The scrubber efficiencies are checked every five years. 


Accident history:

The washougal plant has not experienced any accidents in the last 5 years.


Accident Prevention Program:

The following lines of defense are in place at the Washougal Plant and are designed to prevent accidents, to safeguard employees, the community and environment.  The site follows PSM regulations in all areas of the plant.

Process Design:  Best engineering practices are used to assure systems operate as intended.  Materials of constr

uction are compatable with materials.  Equipment is designed for the intended operating conditions.  Special safety features include containment, ventilation and fixed-mount air analyzers.

A mechanical integrity program is in place to  assure equipment quality and intergity is maintained.  Equipment, instrumentation, and controls are inspected and documented on a routine basis.

The Organics plant is PLC controlled.  Process alarms are built into the control system.  Dedicated operators monitor the process.  Standard operating procedures are in place for all phases of operation.  

If needed, operators can intervein with the process in an alarm condition.  If the operator is unable to midigate an alarm condition, interlocks are built into the control system to bring the process to a safe condition.

If the control system is unable to midigate a hazardous event, relief devices are the next line of defense.  Additionally containment is in place around all process vessels to protect the environment from chemical spills.

The final layer of protection at the Washougal plant is the emergency response plan involving both the plant and the surrounding community.

In addition to the above layers of protection, the Washougal Plant participates in the following PSM activities:

   O  PHA's for the Organics plant are completed or revalidated on a 5 year cyclical schedule.
   O  Plant changes authorized through management of change with PSUSR's conducted prior to operating the change.
   O  Each employee receives extensive process training before operating the Organics Plant.
   O  The PSM elements are audited internally on a bi-monthly schedule.  The entire PSM program is audited by 2nd party
        every three years.  
   O  Process Safety Information is updated every 5 years prior to conducting a PHA.
   O  Employees regularly paricipate in all phases of the PSM program at Washougal.
   O  All incidents are investigated.
   O  The Kemira Quality System at Washougal is cert

ified according to ISO 9002 guidelines. While directed at quality, the
        training and documentation requirements of ISO standards are quite similar to those for OSHA and EPA under Process
       Safety Management and Risk Management.

Emergency Response:

The emergency response plan at Washougal is intended to provide direction and information for personnel in the event of an emergency.  The following outlines the standard response to an incident on site:
   
   O  Preliminary assessment.
   O  Alarm to shelter in place or evacuate to rally point is announced.
   O  Incident reported to 911
   O  Headcount and begin recordkeeping
   O  Establish command center and assign support responsibilities
   O  Neighbor Notifications (if needed)
   O  Detailed assessment and response to incident.  Contract and local responders assest as needed.
   O  Internal and external notifications
   O  Remediation
   O  Investigation and followup

All Washougal employees are trained at HAZMAT technician level.  Severala drills are conducted annually.  Contract responders are the main responders for major incidents.  Training is extended to include these local fire and emergency services groups. Through these training exercises, we are developing partnerships. These partnerships allow us to gain confidence in each other's knowledge and abilities to deal appropriately with incidents. These shared roles in incident response are intended to assure the public, and ourselves, that we can and will react properly and promptly. The Washougal plant is an active member of the Clark County Local Emergency Planning Committee.

Planned changes to improve safety:

   O  Impliment PHA recommendations
   O  Install security cameras and additional lighting to continuously monitor the site
   O  Install upgraded fixed-mount gas detectors
   O  All employees recently trained at HAZMAT technician level
